name: Chile Shrimp
description: These shrimp are a component of arroz gordo, or fat rice, a party dish from Macau, but you could just as easily serve them on their own on a bed of rice, perhaps, or alongside braised bok choy or a smashed cucumber salad.
keywords: fermented black beans, jumbo shrimp, sambal oelek, white wine
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon sambal oelek, sriracha or other Asian chile sauce
1 pound jumbo shrimp, shelled and deveined, about 18

recipeInstructions.text: Combine black beans, sambal oelek and garlic in a large bowl. Add shrimp and coat well.

Heat oil in a large skillet on medium-high. Add shrimp and cook barely a minute on each side, turning as they just start to become pink. Add wine, cover and cook another 3 to 5 minutes until shrimp are done. Serve immediately if desired, or remove from heat and reserve sauce in pan if making arroz gordo.
